title: Fix: footer showing on dependency graph detail pages due to trailing slash mismatch
description:
## Files
- src/components/SiteShell.tsx (modify)

## What to do
The FULLSCREEN_PATTERNS regex on ~line 11 does not account for the trailing slash that Next.js adds when trailingSlash: true is set in next.config.ts.

usePathname() returns paths like /areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/sovereign-dpi/ but the regex ends with [^/]+$ which requires the path to end with a non-slash character.

Change the regex from:
  /^\/areas\/economies-governance\/dependency-graph\/[^/]+$/
to:
  /^\/areas\/economies-governance\/dependency-graph\/[^/]+\/?$/

This makes the trailing slash optional so the fullscreen detection works regardless of trailing slash.

## Don't
- Change any other files
- Modify the SiteFooter component
- Change the trailingSlash config in next.config.ts
- Add new dependencies
acceptance_criteria:
1. The regex in FULLSCREEN_PATTERNS matches paths both with and without a trailing slash (e.g. /areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/sovereign-dpi and /areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/sovereign-dpi/)
2. The footer is NOT rendered on dependency graph detail pages
3. The footer IS still rendered on all other pages
4. No other files are modified besides src/components/SiteShell.tsx
notes: Fix applied: regex updated to make trailing slash optional (/[^/]+\/?$/). Awaiting commit from user per instructions.
close_reason: 6b9d369 fix: account for trailing slash in fullscreen pattern

title: Epic: Markdown-driven dependency graph data
description:
Move dependency graph data from hardcoded TypeScript into markdown+frontmatter files that compile to JSON via the existing content pipeline. This lets non-technical contributors edit graph nodes, tooltips, and relationships by editing markdown files and proposing PRs.

**Current state:** Graph data lives in 4 TypeScript files (data/*.ts) + inline tooltipData in DependencyGraph.tsx. Not editable without code knowledge.

**Target state:** 4 markdown files in content/areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/ with YAML frontmatter containing all node configs and tooltips. build-content.mjs compiles them to src/data/generated/dependency-graph.json. Components import from generated JSON.

**Key constraints:**
- Graph must render identically after migration (zero visual regression)
- Frontmatter schema must be intuitive for non-developers
- Follow existing content pipeline pattern (gray-matter + remark → JSON)
- Shared intervention tooltips (i1-i8) included in each IP file, build deduplicates

title: Add dependency graph builder to build-content.mjs
description:
## Files
- scripts/build-content.mjs (modify)

## What to do
Add a `buildDependencyGraph()` function to the existing build script that reads the 4 markdown files from `content/areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/*.md` and outputs `src/data/generated/dependency-graph.json`.

### Input
4 markdown files with YAML frontmatter (created by prior tasks). Each file has frontmatter with: id, label, sub, color, num, tooltip, bottlenecks[], gates[], strands[], interventions[], feedbackLoops[].

Each bottleneck/gate/strand/intervention has an optional `tooltip` object with {title, body, context}.

### Output JSON structure
```json
{
  "sovereign-dpi": {
    "config": {
      "id": "ip1",
      "label": "...",
      "sub": "...",
      "color": "#B07D10",
      "num": "01",
      "bottlenecks": [{ "id": "b1a", "label": "..." }],
      "gates": [{ "id": "g1q2", "label": "...", "quarter": "Q2" }],
      "strands": [{ "id": "s1a", "label": "...", "sub": "..." }],
      "interventions": [{ "id": "i1", "label": "...", "sub": "...", "strands": ["s1a"] }],
      "feedbackLoops": [{ "id": "fl1a", "from": "s1c", "to": "b1b", "label": "..." }]
    },
    "tooltips": {
      "ip1": { "title": "...", "body": "...", "context": "..." },
      "b1a": { "title": "...", "body": "...", "context": "..." },
      ...
    }
  },
  ...4 entries total
}
```

### Implementation details
1. Use the existing `readDir` pattern but read loose `.md` files from `content/areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/`
2. For each file, extract the slug from the filename (e.g., `sovereign-dpi.md` → `"sovereign-dpi"`)
3. Build `config` by stripping `tooltip` from each node array item (bottlenecks, gates, strands, interventions) — config should NOT contain tooltip data
4. Build `tooltips` by collecting: the IP-level tooltip (keyed by `id`), plus tooltip from each bottleneck/gate/strand/intervention (keyed by their `id`)
5. Write to `src/data/generated/dependency-graph.json`
6. Add to the main build flow: call `buildDependencyGraph()` after existing builders, write the JSON file alongside the others
7. Add a console.log line like the existing ones: `console.log(\`  ${Object.keys(depGraph).length} dependency graphs\`)`

### Critical: config must NOT contain tooltip fields
When building the config object, strip the `tooltip` property from each node. The config arrays should only have the structural fields (id, label, sub, quarter, strands, from, to).

## Don't
- Change any existing builder functions
- Modify output format of existing JSON files
- Add new npm dependencies (gray-matter is already available)
acceptance_criteria:
1. buildDependencyGraph() function exists in scripts/build-content.mjs
2. Running `node scripts/build-content.mjs` produces src/data/generated/dependency-graph.json
3. JSON has 4 top-level keys: sovereign-dpi, public-goods-funding, governance-democracy, climate-infrastructure
4. Each entry has config (IPConfig shape without tooltip fields) and tooltips (Record<string, TooltipEntry>)
5. Config bottlenecks/gates/strands/interventions do NOT contain tooltip property
6. Tooltips map includes IP-level entry (keyed by id like ip1) plus all node tooltips
7. Console output includes dependency graph count
8. Existing content builds still work (publications, authors, etc.)

### 1. src/lib/content.ts — Add types and import
Add at the top:

```typescript
import depGraphData from '@/data/generated/dependency-graph.json'
```

Add types (after existing types):
```typescript
export type DependencyGraphTooltip = {
  title: string
  body: string
  context: string
}

export type DependencyGraphEntry = {
  config: {
    id: string
    label: string
    sub: string
    color: string
    num: string
    bottlenecks: { id: string; label: string }[]
    gates: { id: string; label: string; quarter: string }[]
    strands: { id: string; label: string; sub: string }[]

```

Add export at the bottom:
```typescript
export const dependencyGraphs = depGraphData as Record<string, DependencyGraphEntry>
```

### 2. data/index.ts — Import from generated JSON
Replace the entire file with:
```typescript
import { dependencyGraphs } from '@/lib/content'
import type { IPConfig } from '../DependencyGraph'

export const expandedConfigs: Record<string, IPConfig> = Object.fromEntries(
  Object.entries(dependencyGraphs).map(([slug, entry]) => [slug, entry.config as IPConfig])
)

export const allTooltips: Record<string, { title: string; body: string; context: string }> = Object.fromEntries(
  Object.entries(dependencyGraphs).flatMap(([, entry]) => Object.entries(entry.tooltips))
)
```

### 3. DependencyGraph.tsx — Use generated tooltips, remove inline data
- Remove the entire `tooltipData` record (lines 137-182, the big `const tooltipData: Record<string, TooltipEntry> = { ... }` block)

- Replace all references to `tooltipData` with `allTooltips` (search for `tooltipData[` — it appears in the Tooltip component around line 399)
- Also remove the `ipConfigs` array (lines 184-276) — it is no longer needed since index page will use generated data

### 4. page.tsx (index) — Derive CARDS from generated data
Replace the hardcoded CARDS array with:
```typescript
import { dependencyGraphs } from '@/lib/content'

const CARDS = Object.entries(dependencyGraphs)
  .map(([slug, entry]) => ({
    num: entry.config.num,
    title: entry.config.label,
    sub: entry.config.sub,
    slug,
    color: entry.config.color,
  }))
  .sort((a, b) => a.num.localeCompare(b.num))
```

### 5. [slug]/page.tsx — Update generateStaticParams
Replace the hardcoded array with:
```typescript
import { dependencyGraphs } from '@/lib/content'

export function generateStaticParams() {
  return Object.keys(dependencyGraphs).map((slug) => ({ slug }))
}
```
Keep the rest of the file (generateMetadata, page component) the same — they already use expandedConfigs from data/index.ts.

### 6. Delete old TypeScript data files
Delete these 4 files:
- src/app/areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/data/sovereign-dpi.ts
- src/app/areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/data/public-goods-funding.ts
- src/app/areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/data/governance-democracy.ts
- src/app/areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/data/climate-infrastructure.ts

## Don't
- Change the type definitions (IPConfig, TooltipEntry, etc.) in DependencyGraph.tsx — they are still used by the component
- Change ANY rendering logic, force-graph config, or visual behavior
- Remove the type exports from DependencyGraph.tsx (IPConfig, TooltipEntry, etc. are imported by data/index.ts)

3. DependencyGraph.tsx no longer contains inline tooltipData or ipConfigs — uses allTooltips from data/index.ts

title: Epic: Dependency Graph Subpages — one full-page graph per inflection point
description:

Split the single dependency-graph page (currently shows all 4 IPs stacked vertically) into 4 dedicated subpages — one per inflection point. Each subpage gets the full page width/height to render a significantly more detailed dependency graph with:
- Multiple Q4 gates (staged Q2→Q3→Q4→Q1'26 decision checkpoints)
- Reinforcing feedback loops (backward edges showing how outputs feed back into earlier stages)

## Context
Current page: /areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/
New structure:
- /areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/ → index with 4 cards
- /areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/sovereign-dpi/
- /areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/public-goods-funding/
- /areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/governance-democracy/
- /areas/economies-governance/dependency-graph/climate-infrastructure/

## Scope
- Refactor routing (index + [slug] dynamic route)
- Enhance DependencyGraph.tsx to support multi-gate columns and feedback loop edges
- Create expanded data for each IP with 3-4 gates and 2-4 feedback loops
- Keep existing design language, colors, tooltips, hover behavior

## Success
All 4 subpages render correctly with expanded graphs. Index page links to all 4. No regressions.

## What to do
Extend the existing graph rendering to support TWO new features needed by the subpages:

### 1. Multiple Gates
Currently each IP has a single `gate: GateConfig`. Change to an array:

```ts
type GateConfig = { id: string; label: string; quarter: string } // add quarter field e.g. 'Q2', 'Q3', 'Q4', 'Q1 2026'

type IPConfig = {
  // ... existing fields ...
  gates: GateConfig[]  // RENAMED from 'gate' to 'gates', now an array
  // ... rest same ...
}
```

Layout changes for multi-gate:
- The gate column becomes wider. Each gate gets stacked vertically like bottlenecks are now (with BN_GAP-style spacing).
- Each gate shows its quarter label (e.g. 'Q2') as a tiny superscript above the gate text.
- Edges: ALL bottlenecks connect to the FIRST gate. Each gate connects to the next gate in sequence (left→right within the gate column, using short horizontal curves). The LAST gate fans out to all strands.
- Alternatively (simpler): stack gates vertically, bottlenecks → all gates (fan), last gate → strands. Use the simpler approach.

### 2. Feedback Loops
Add a new optional field to IPConfig:

```ts
type FeedbackLoop = {
  id: string
  from: string   // node id (strand or intervention)
  to: string     // node id (bottleneck, gate, or strand)
  label: string  // short label like 'Evidence compounds'
}

type IPConfig = {
  // ... existing fields ...
  feedbackLoops?: FeedbackLoop[]
}
```

Rendering feedback loops:
- Draw as dashed curved arrows going RIGHT-TO-LEFT (backwards), colored with a muted teal (#0D9488, opacity 0.3).
- The curve should arc BELOW the main graph area (add ~60px extra bottom padding when feedbackLoops exist).
- Path: from the source node's bottom-center, curve down below the graph, back up to the target node's bottom-center.
- Add a small arrowhead at the target end.
- On hover of a feedback loop edge, show a tooltip with the loop's label.
- Add 'Feedback loop' to the legend when feedbackLoops exist, using the teal color + dashed style.

### 3. Export changes
- Keep the default export `DependencyGraph` that renders all IPs (for backwards compat)
- ALSO export `IPFigure` as a named export so subpages can render a single IP
- ALSO export `ipConfigs` so subpages can reference existing data
- ALSO export all types: `IPConfig`, `GateConfig`, `StrandConfig`, `BottleneckConfig`, `InterventionConfig`, `FeedbackLoop`

### 4. Backward compat
Update the existing `ipConfigs` data to use `gates: [{ ...existingGate, quarter: 'Q4' }]` (single-element arrays) so the old all-IPs view still works.

## Don't
- Don't change the color palette or tooltip styling
- Don't change the existing card rendering (renderCard function shape)
- Don't remove any existing tooltip data
- Don't add npm dependencies
acceptance_criteria:
1. DependencyGraph.tsx exports: default DependencyGraph, named IPFigure, named ipConfigs, all types

3. Existing ipConfigs updated to gates array format (single element each)
4. Multi-gate layout renders gates stacked vertically with sequential connections
5. Feedback loop edges render as dashed teal arcs below the graph
6. Legend includes 'Feedback loop' entry when loops exist

8. No TypeScript errors
